perturbation.original_text:
4.  COMPENSATION

      4.1 Products. TDA will provide to Smith, free of all costs whatsoever (including without limitation, taxes, duties, shipping and/or handling fees) (a) fifty (50) copies each of TDA's "Phil Smith Golf instruction related" game mobile, handheld devices promptly after TDA's release thereof and (b) fifty (50) copies of any other TDA products selected by Smith.

      4.2 Compensation for Rights and Services. TDA agrees to pay Smith, as a consideration for the Rights and Services.

      1)    25,000 Restricted common shares of TDA,

            a.    As of the date of this agreement, Company has sold stock at                   $2.50/share.

            b.    Par Value is $.0001 per share.

      2)    25% royalty of net TDA net sales price.

      3)    Option to convert annual royalties to TDA common stock at a $10 of             stock for every $1 of Royalty converted.

            a.    TDA stock conversion price based on the previous six month                   average daily price

            b.    Option is limited to 50% of TDA outstanding stock and if the                   option is exercised, it must be exercised when the agreement     &sbsp;             is in effect.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.  COMPENSATION

      4.1 Products. TDA will provide to Smith, free of all costs whatsoever (including without limitation, taxes, duties, shipping and/or handling fees) (a) fifty (50) copies each of TDA's "Phil Smith Golf instruction related" game mobile, handheld devices promptly after TDA's release thereof and (b) fifty (50) copies of any other TDA products selected by Smith.

      4.2 Compensation for Rights and Services. TDA agrees to pay Smith, as a consideration for the Rights and Services.

      1)    25,000 Restricted common shares of TDA,

            a.    As of the date of this agreement, Company has sold stock at                   $2.50/share.

            b.    Par Value is $.0001 per share.

      2)    25% royalty of net TDA net sales price.

      3)    Option to convert annual royalties to TDA common stock at a $10 of             stock for every $1 of Royalty converted.

            a.    TDA stock conversion price based on the previous six month                   average daily price

            b.    Option is limited to 10% of TDA outstanding stock and if the                   option is exercised, it must be exercised when the agreement is in effect.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Smith has the option to convert annual royalties to TDA common stock, limited to 50% of TDA outstanding stock. The modified text changes the limit to 10%. This introduces a contradiction regarding the extent to which Smith can convert royalties into stock, which could lead to a dispute regarding the amount of stock Smith is entitled to.

perturbation.original_text:
All payments due under this Agreement shall be made in the form of a check drawn to the order of "Rick Smith" and delivered to Smith's agent at the following address: Gaylord Sports Management, l4646 N. Kierland Blvd., Suite 230, Scottsdale, Arizona 85254, Attn: Steve Loy. Payments shall be made 15 days from the end of each

                                       2

quarter. Smith's net payment after any such charges or deductions shall equal the amount set forth above. Past due payments hereunder shall bear interest at the rate of (i) one and one-half percent (1-1/2%) per month, or (ii) the maximum interest rate permissible under law, whichever is less.
perturbation.changed_text:
All payments due under this Agreement shall be made in the form of a check drawn to the order of "Rick Smith" and delivered to Smith's agent at the following address: Gaylord Sports Management, l4646 N. Kierland Blvd., Suite 230, Scottsdale, Arizona 85254, Attn: Steve Loy. Payments shall be made 60 days from the end of each

                                       2

quarter. Smith's net payment after any such charges or deductions shall equal the amount set forth above. Past due payments hereunder shall bear interest at the rate of (i) one and one-half percent (1-1/2%) per month, or (ii) the maximum interest rate permissible under law, whichever is less.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that payments shall be made 15 days from the end of each quarter. The modified text changes this to 60 days. This creates conflicting terms for payment deadlines.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Taxes. Smith represents and warrants that, in performing its obligations under this Agreement, Smith does so as an independent contractor and, without limiting the foregoing, Smith assumes exclusive responsibility for the collection and payments of all employer and employee contributions and taxes under all applicable laws now in effect or hereafter enacted and Smith further agrees to file any returns or reports necessary in connection therewith. TDA shall have the right to deduct from any amounts payable hereunder such portion thereof as are required to be deducted under applicable statute, regulation, treaty or other law, and Smith shall promptly execute and deliver to TDA such forms and other documents as may be required in connection therewith. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, it is agreed and acknowledged that TDA remains liable for the payment of all pension and health welfare contributions required of any guild or labor organization (i.e., SAG, AFTRA, etc.).
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Taxes. Smith represents and warrants that, in performing its obligations under this Agreement, Smith does so as an independent contractor. TDA shall be solely responsible for the collection and payments of all employer and employee contributions and taxes under all applicable laws now in effect or hereafter enacted and TDA further agrees to file any returns or reports necessary in connection therewith. TDA shall have the right to deduct from any amounts payable hereunder such portion thereof as are required to be deducted under applicable statute, regulation, treaty or other law, and Smith shall promptly execute and deliver to TDA such forms and other documents as may be required in connection therewith. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, it is agreed and acknowledged that TDA remains liable for the payment of all pension and health welfare contributions required of any guild or labor organization (i.e., SAG, AFTRA, etc.).
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Smith is responsible for the collection and payments of all employer and employee contributions and taxes. The modified text changes this by indicating that TDA is responsible for these contributions and taxes. This creates a contradiction regarding who is liable for the tax obligations.
